projects.title: Brainchild: A Kinect-VR joint venture
projects.short_description: Kinect VR - Physiotherapy and Gait Analysis; Gamify Tedious excersises in VR to hasten Rehab. Diagnose Motor skill disorder and monitor improvements.
projects.long_description: Gait and posture are important parameters of human movement that are impaired in the case of movement disorders, such as cerebral palsy. In such disorders, aspects of motor movement like balance and co-ordination are adversely aected. Cerebral palsy, in particular, can be treated by physical, occupational and speech therapy. But there is no cure. Physiotherapy is often prescribed to aected patients, but the rate of follow through is usually very low as patients nd very little incentive to complete their routines. We present a two-fold solution to this problem. We have developed a suite of virtual reality games that aim to gamify the physiotherapy routines, thereby providing incentive for patients to regularly engage in their prescribed exercises. We have also used the data obtained from the player's motions during the game to analyse joint angles and aid in the diagnosis of cerebral palsy. Additionally, the data so obtained was used to track a player's progress in posture and gait through the course of the physiotherapy regimen. This progress chart can be made available to the doctor overseeing the patient, who can then use this information to alter the physiotherapy as per the individual's requirement.
projects.mentors: Vasisht Guru Prasad, Rahul Ragesh, Pratik Shiyal
projects.interns: Karan Rao, Manasa Jadadeesh, Nikitha Rao, Rohan Mohaptra, Sreenivas M Kandhade

projects.title: Emotion Analysis using machine learning
projects.short_description: Detection of emotion patterns based on social media platforms and chats.
projects.long_description: Our application determines if a person is falling into depression based on his twitter feed and gives him suggestions based on what data he has entered previously.
projects.interns: Deepali Prabhu, Manish Soni, Sree Hari K

projects.title: Explodroid
projects.short_description: To create a robot from scratch, which can map any unknown environment and then navigate around it autonomously.
projects.long_description: Creating a development platform from scratch, using Kinect to generate a laser-scan which generates a map to navigate autonomously
projects.interns: Prasanna Venaktesan K S, Manoj Surya K, Tarun Bhargav Sriram, Dweepa Prasad

projects.title: Logophile's Companion
projects.short_description: A Customized Vocabulary Assistant
projects.long_description: Built a Customized Vocabulary Assistant, titled Logophile's Companion. Imagine the arduous task of pausing a video every time you hear a "complex" work and looking up its meaning? Wouldn't it be a lot easier to automate this process, but at the same time ensure that you learn the word and its usage? Logophiles' Companion tags meanings to "Non-Trivial" words which occur in a video to ensure that the viewer gets a fun and an informative learning experience when watching. At the heart of it, the project uses a neural network trained to categorize words (based on difficulty) with a feedback mechanism to account for the viewers improving vocabulary in the learn-as-you-go model.
projects.interns: Sumanth V Rao, Suraj Aralihalli, Tanmaya Udupa

projects.title: Mapping of Textual Description to Facial Image
projects.short_description: Mapping of Textual Description to Facial Image
projects.long_description: Our idea involves the creation of a software application which helps the user retrieve the face of a person from a database just by inputting a description of his facial features. Our implementation makes use of image processing principles in conjunction with a neural network to extract and classify features from a given database of facial images at its core while, the complete application will also make use of NLP concepts. This application can be used as an assistant to sketch artists in the criminal investigation procedure, to reduce the time required to develop a sketch by searching for the suspect from a database of images of known criminals. It can also work like a shazam for celebrities and in other similar applications where an image is to be retrieved based on its textual/verbal description.
projects.interns: Piyush Surana, Varun Ranganathan

projects.title: ModCube
projects.short_description: A Self-reconfigurable modular robotic system using electromagnets for versatile application
projects.long_description: To build a modular robot with the ability to flip and attach to other units with the help of electromagnets.

projects.title: Work In Progress
projects.short_description: A Rerouting App to inform about road conditions
projects.long_description: Bengaluru has been facing a crucial problem of potholes and road flooding during monsoon and its erratic weather pattern gives way to a lot of problems. There is no method which has been deployed to warn drivers about road health and rising water levels due to flooding.Vehicle failure is more prone to happen due to the above reason and thus eventually lead to heavy traffic. Thus our project aims at helping daily commuters by informing them via an app about damaged and waterlogged roads they may face enroute.
projects.interns: Sameer Dhole, Animesh ND, Meghana V S, Maanvi Nunna

projects.title: Ball Catcher
projects.short_description: To estimate the trajectory of the thrown ball and collect it using a robotic arm.

projects.title: MakinWaves
projects.short_description: Motor Imagery based Brain-Computer Interface
projects.long_description: This project aims To develop a Brain-Computer Interface that uses changes in sensorimotor rhythms recorded from Electroencephalographic signals as control signals for an external device. Evoked Potentials from Motor Imagery are recorded and used to classify kinesthetic actions based on the EEG signal generated.
projects.interns: Aushim Nagarkatti, Malaika Vijay, Shruti Mohanty

projects.title: Oculus
projects.short_description: Classification of Ocular Signals using Electrooculography to Control External Devices
projects.long_description: To control the cursor on a computer screen with the movement of eyeballs using Electrooculogram (EOG) headset.
projects.interns: Siddarth Karki, Sumedh Basarkod, Vishal S

projects.title: Reinforcement Learning For Games
projects.short_description: Reinforcement Learning applied to train video game agents for better gaming experience.
projects.long_description: We used concepts of Q and Deep Q Learning to train reinforcement learning agents for training better AI in games. We explored the concepts of OpenAI design, and applied our final design to Doom 3D. After 3 days of playing itself on a commodity system, our bot could achieve 100% accuracy in the game.
projects.keywords: Machine Learning, Game Development, Reinforcement Learning
projects.interns: Ishaan Lagwankar, Saksham Goyal, Niharika Pentapati

projects.title: VRchitect
projects.short_description: Conversion of Rudimentary Floor Plans into an Interactive Virtual Walkthrough
projects.long_description: Construction and Fabrication of a Building is a time consuming process. The tools required to visualize the building before construction are not easily available. This project aims to change that. The goal is to make the visualization process simple and seamless using VR technology. Taking rudimentary floor plans as input this software creates an interactive virtual environment. The application uses OpenCV to process the image of a handdrawn floor plan that has walls and doors. Using the coordinates, Unity renders this as a virtual environment. Finally this environment is made accessible via a mobile app developed by Kivy (Python Framework)
projects.keywords: VR, Unity, Image Processing, Floor Plans, Construction, Interactive
projects.interns: Aishwarya Venkatesh, Karan Panjabi, Aditya Girisha

projects.title: ApatheticML
projects.short_description: Cloud-agnostic, distributed Machine Learning
projects.long_description: This project aims to parallelize the computations involved in machine learning algorithms, thereby improving their efficiency. It also aims to make the framework architecture-independent by using Kubernetes for both implementation across platforms such as Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS etc. or a cluster of machines connected locally. This work explores the effect of parallelism on some algorithms such as Linear and Logistic Regression, K-Means Clustering, Random Forest and Artificial Neural Networks and discusses the effects of external factors such as network delays and the mode of communication used.
projects.interns: Vishwas Rajashekar , Aditi Ahuja, Raunak Sengupta, Sparsh Temani

projects.title: CritiQuali
projects.short_description: Customer review analysis to return company's critical issues.
projects.long_description: Built a Customer Feedback Model to analyze the customer review data of a company, and help identify critical issues based on their severity and impact on customers as well as management. Customer review data for a company is collected and classified into categories (buckets). Aspect-based sentiment/emotion analysis is performed to filter out the negative-sentiment issues; Non-granular reviews (reviews that don’t give specific/detailed issues) are removed using dependency parsing, and issues are ranked based on a severity score that is generated, to finally return the top-ranked issues.
projects.interns: Abhigna L Shastry, Karan Kumar G, Sumukh Aithal K

projects.title: Multi-terrain 3D Mapping Drone
projects.short_description: To build an unmanned aerial vehicle that goes on multiple terrains and using recorded flight data to create and map terrains for real-world applications
projects.long_description: The project deals with the creation of a multi-terrain, 3D-mapping unmanned aerial vehicle.It is achieved by attaching a set of modified wheels to a carbon fiber drone frame with the help of laser-cut acrylic sheets. The drone supports 3D reconstruction and mapping using a stereo-camera setup and OpenCV.
projects.interns: Aravind S, Agnibha Bhattacharyya, Rajat Hegde, Shrenik R

projects.title: Mythodex
projects.short_description: Automated identification of scenes from Indian mythology using neural networks and text processing.
projects.long_description: The aim of the project is to automate the identification of scenes from Indian mythology in works of art. A trained neural network is used to extract image features and categorize them. Images passed through the model undergo multiple levels of filtering and result in a list of elements (characters,animals,landscapes etc) from the image that bear meaningful relationships. The outputs from this level are analysed and mapped to a scene from the epics using a graph-based model. The end result of the project is an accurate identification and description of the scene being depicted.
projects.interns: Ashwin R Bharadwaj, Abdur Rahman Hatim, Devika S Nair, Shreeram Suresh Chandra

projects.title: Pressure2Path
projects.short_description: Using a smartphone's barometer to track the live location of the device, thereby removing the permanent dependency on GPS.
projects.long_description: Advancements in technology has led to the development of countless applications that aid in areas such as navigation and positioning. Many functionalities, such as GPS, have been made accessible to the masses via mobile devices, and provide accurate results. However, the major drawback of such accuracy is the high amounts of power consumed by the phone. Given the limited battery capacity of such devices, prolonged use of the aforementioned functionalities becomes difficult. Observing this issue, it is clear that there is a need to provide accurate positioning while improving power efficiency. This project aims to achieve accurate tracking of the device location while navigating along a predefined route, relying on the pressure data collected by the barometer sensor present in the smartphone. The algorithm is made accurate using cell tower data collected by the phone on said route.
projects.interns: Anirudh S, Pranav Bhatt, Hardik Gourisaria

projects.title: Project X
projects.short_description: Autonomous car simulation using Reinforcement Learning
projects.long_description: The field of mobility is going through a revolution that is changing how we understand transportation. We live in the beginning of the Autonomous Driving era. The potential benefits of autonomous vehicles are immense: elimination of accidents caused by human errors, a reduction in carbon dioxide emission, more efficient use of energy and infrastructure, among others. This kind of vehicle has become a concrete reality and may pave the way for future systems where computers take over the art of driving. In this paper, we present a 2-model approach for autonomous driving of car in a cityscape. The first model is used to drive the car in a no - traffic lane from an initial start location to the destination. The second model modifies the speed and brake states of the car on detecting obstacles within a specified range. We have trained the models using Reinforcement Learning in a simulator environment provided by CARLA.
projects.interns: Saahil Jain, Kavya S, Vishwa Pravin

projects.title: Prosthetic Actuation System
projects.short_description: A system which aids a disabled person confined to a wheelchair, by locating the object chosen and actuating accordingly
projects.long_description:
The project involves developing a system which aids a disabled person confined to a wheelchair by coupling a robotic arm with the wheelchair. A stereo camera is used to localize object present in front of the wheelchair, where recognition of the objects is done using Convolutional Neural Networks. The user is allowed to choose objects via touchscreen interface after it's recognition and segmentation. The real world coordinates of the chosen object is obtained using the point cloud of the FOV of the stereo camera and they are used to find the elevation and azimuth of the servo motors of the foundation of the robotic arm, which actuates and aligns itself with the chosen object. The chosen object's pose is tracked continuously irrespective of the movement of the wheelchair.
This acts as a framework for a robotic arm having at least 3 DOF.
projects.keywords: Rehabilitation Robotics, Stereo Vision, Convolutional Neural Networks, Wheelchair
projects.interns: B.R Srikrishna, Prajwal Billawa

projects.title: Roadmap
projects.short_description: Web tool for graphical descriptions of learning flows.
projects.long_description: Over the years, the ways and processes people have employed to consume information and learn have changed in innumerable ways. The biggest change perhaps, is the emergence of the internet as the clear victor as a global source of knowledge. For the sake of argument, the internet may be thought of as a big, disorganised kitchen with many chefs and no particular distribution of dish workload among them. Say chef-A fashions a particularly scrumptious starter dish-X while being moderately skilled at making the main course dish-Y and sadly, makes a rather foul dessert dish-Z. His colleague, chef-B makes a Michelin worthy main course dish-Y but is so-so at the other two components of a meal. Enter chef-C. He makes the best Poire la Beaujolaise (call it dish-Z) but is simply incapable of making anything else. Now, if you wanted a 3-course meal, what are your chances of getting an optimal dish-A, dish-B and dish-C and in that particular order? Bleak indeed. This is pre- cisely the issue that Roadmap solves. Deconstructing the analogy, the chefs are websites and the dishes are resources. Akin to a meal, information must be consumed in a particular order and from the right source(s). Roadmap identifies blocks of prerequisite information pertaining to the desired ob- jective topic and presents a platter of ranked resources procured from apt sources. These tasks are accomplished by parsing through various resources and identifying parent-child relationships between entities by virtue of varied approaches such as semantic nets, N-space clustering, ANNs that analyse the statistical occurrences of entities and even contextualised word embeddings. Going back to the analogy one last time, Roadmap takes structured learning from ”too many chefs spoil the broth” to ”the more the merrier”.
projects.interns: Akshay Vasudeva Rao, Prakruti Prakash Rao, Ruchika Shashidhara, Sourav T Raveendran

projects.title: Timetable Generation
projects.short_description: Development of a web application to aid the process of Timetable Generation
projects.long_description: Timetable scheduling can be designed as a constraint satisfaction problem and can be solved using various approaches. An optimal solution for a timetable scheduling problem is difficult to find using any generic algorithm, due to the diverse nature of hard constraints and preferences also known as soft constraints, which may vary from institution to institution. Various approaches aimed at finding optimal solutions to such constraint satisfaction problems use constraint optimization, coupled with algorithms such as genetic, swarm particle optimization, tabu search etc. but these approaches are problem dependent and hence are infeasible in real-world situations. In this project, a pure Linear Constrained Optimization approach consisting of integer programming using binary variables has been explored. The developed solver class was tested using real-world data gathered from the various departments of a university. On further inspection, the constraints of every department were strikingly different from each other. The solver class to be successful must accommodate such diversities and still generate optimal results. It was successfully able to handle all the hard constraints and optimize for almost all the soft constraints. This solution can be applied to a wide variety of real-world scheduling problems with the capability of add-on features.
projects.interns: Akash Hamirwasia, Rishit Chaudhary, Tanishq Vyas

projects.title: UniBot: A Generalised Chatbot Framework
projects.short_description: Designing a generalised chatbot framework for customer facing applications
projects.long_description: A generalised chatbot which can intelligently respond to conversation using named entity recognition (NER), sentiment analysis and an implementation of a decision system for follow up mechanism using a Seq2seq model which uses Bidirectional RNNs and Attention models.
projects.interns: Taran, Tejas, Sonam

projects.title: WSN Modelling
projects.short_description: Design and Comparison of Wireless Sensor Networks
projects.long_description: This project aims to build an application in which a user who has insufficient knowledge about the various aspects related to designing a Wireless Sensor Network can input some basic needs of their network such as area, cost and type of Wireless Sensor Network required and the User Interface will help the user in doing so by appropriately stating the aspects that need to be taken care of while setting up the user-defined Wireless Sensor Network. The application will specify various things such as the placement of the nodes, the type of nodes to be used, etc. Wireless Sensor Network node placement models are proposed which concentrate on one specific parameter viz., lifetime, latency and reliability. The user can choose the type of model according to his needs and the simulation is done accordingly. Thus, the project compares WSN Architectures to find the best architecture to setup a WSN based on the constraints provided whilst also simulating all those results infographically to aid the user in setting up a simple Wireless Sensor Network.
projects.interns: Anish Reddy Y, Akshobhya Jamadagni K R, Shreyas GS, Shriprajwal Krishnamurthy

projects.title: Drone Forces
projects.short_description: An autonomous drone which monitors and localizes cracks on a building
projects.long_description: With  the  rapid  industrialization  going  across  the  world,  the  need  to  build strong  buildings  with  high  structural  strength  has  become  quite  evident .However numerous amounts of cases of possible cracks has led down to catastrophic disasters of severe structural damages to buildings.  Thus, the following project involves the use of drones to find an efficient way of monitoring potential pitfalls in the foundation of a building to avoid catastrophic hazards
projects.keywords: ROS, Drone Computing, Image Processing, Neural Network, Path Planning, PID, Kalman Filter, Simulation
projects.mentors: Srikishna BR, Aravind S, Sameer Dhole
projects.interns: Suhas Thalanki, Harshith Kumar MB, T Vijay Prashant, Shayak Bhadraray

projects.title: Aproximately Private
projects.short_description: A privacy preserving deep learning framework, optimized using approximate computing
projects.long_description:
This project aims to build a privacy-preserving deep learning framework
using cryptographic protocols like garbled circuits and oblivious transfers.

The computational and communication cost of the model are reduced by applying approximations at various stages of computation, such as data per-processing, model pruning and activation functions. 

The results from testing the model are collated to obtain information about error rate vs processing time tradeoffs.
projects.keywords: Deep Learning, Secure Function Evaluation, Garbled Circuit, Approximate computing
projects.interns: Aasim Mohammed, Chirag Kashyap S, Rehan Vipin

projects.title: Neural Music
projects.short_description: A web-app designed to help complete a user's music using Algorithmic analyses and Deep Learning.
projects.long_description:
The process of composing a lead, or composing
an accompaniment to an existing lead, can be a daunting process. This project aims to automate either process, allowing musicians to focus on the
aspect they are better at. The former is done via a simple RNN-LSTM deep learning model trained on a host of melodies, while the latter is done by breaking down the lead and performing various algorithmic analyses on it.
projects.keywords: Music Generation, Deep Learning, LSTM, Melodia, Algorithms
projects.interns: Murali Krishna, Nihal R, Moyank Giri

projects.title: Smart City Control and Management
projects.short_description: A versatile and scalable network to manage sensors across a city.
projects.long_description: A scalable yet versatile cloud-based system with a custom-built dashboard built with Dash, Kafka and OpenWhisk to control and manage sensor data in a large vicinity.
projects.keywords: Openwhisk, Kafka, Dashboard, FaaS, IoT, Docker
projects.interns: Chetan Athni, Sakshi Vattikuti, Hemant Sathish, A Anantha Krishna

projects.title: BREVIS
projects.short_description: Structured Notes For Online Lecture Videos
projects.long_description:
With education becoming virtual, studying from lecture videos can be time-consuming and tedious. Students tend to miss classes due to various reasons thereby missing out on fundamental concepts.
Brevis is an application that aims to provide its users with a complete package of lecture notes enhanced with other online resources.
The lecture notes are generated for a YouTube video of the user's choice. Familiar processes such as text summarization, keyword extraction, and web scraping are performed on the transcript of the video. If the transcript for the entered video is not available, we generate the transcript by processing its audio. Further formatting is done to extract and insert video snapshots and segment text into separate paragraphs. The sole purpose of this is to structure notes generated in a way that the user can comprehend them easily.
projects.keywords: Automation, Lecture Videos, Transcript, NLP, Image Processing
projects.interns: Mayank Agrawal, Himanshu Jain, Rahul D Makhija, Aniket Aayush

projects.title: Benchmarking of NODE
projects.short_description: Comparison of NODE to other neural networks and Machine Learning algorithms.
projects.long_description: The aim of this project is to compare Neural Ordinary Differential Equations (NODE) to other neural networks and machine learning algorithms with respect to Time Series forecasting and image processing. Time Series forecasting was done in order to compare the performance of NODE when predicting COVID-19 cases and deaths. Comparisons were made with LSTMs, GRUs, RNNs, simple neural networks, Gradient Boosting algorithm, Linear Regression, and Polynomial Regression. Image processing was done in order to compare the performance of NODE with respect to the MNIST and CIFAR datasets. Comparisons were made with CNNs (with and without transfer learning) and RESNET. Additionally, the time-accuracy tradeoff for NODE was also tested.
projects.interns: Aanchal Narendran, Kartika Nair, Sujith K

projects.title: Project WiSeN
projects.short_description: An exploration of novel approaches to routing in wireless sensor networks.
projects.long_description: The project involved the study of new routing protocols and mechanisms to forward data in wireless sensor networks via the use of a mobile sink station. WSNs generally consist of a collection of sensor nodes which collect and send data to a sink node, which acts as a gateway to a base station. Different protocols for transmission of data can cause drastic differences in the lifespan of these nodes. Thus, our project aims to reduce the power consumption in these nodes by inspecting routing protocols involving a mobile sink as opposed to a static one.
projects.keywords: networks, sensors, wireless, routing, energy-efficiency, algorithms
projects.interns: Hrishit Chaudhuri, Rithvik Rama, Amogh KM, Surya Dutta

projects.title: AQVis
projects.short_description: Air Quality Visualisation and Analytics on Cloud
projects.long_description: Air quality has always been a growing concern in today’s world. AQVis is a cloud-based visualization and analytics platform. This project (AQVis) aims to be the Cloud-based counterpart of the Air Quality sensors. The data is sent from sensors to the cloud (Google Cloud Platform) and then is visualized onto the web page as graphs that users can access. A dashboard created houses the relevant visualizations and maps to generate useful insights from the data.
projects.keywords: Air Quality Visualisation, Google Cloud Platform, OpenLayers, Elastic stack, Kubernetes
projects.mentors: Dr. Venkatarangan M.J, Animesh ND, Vishwas R, Yashas ND
projects.interns: Ashutosh Rao, Srinath Kesav Nallamalli, Srujan Vasudevrao Deshpande

projects.title: DisContNet
projects.short_description: Contradiction detection in sentence pairs using NLP and Deep Learning.
projects.long_description:
"We are team DisContNet"
"We are definitely not team DisContNet"
Contradictory, isn't it?

DisContNet is a contradiction detecting system that uses NLP and deep learning. We use a BERT based model to label sentences as per 4 labels: contradictory (general), non-contradictory, contradiction due to negation, and numeric contradiction.
projects.keywords: Contradiction, Sentence pairs, NLP, Deep learning, ML
projects.mentors: Hrishit Chaudhuri, Suhas Thalanki, Vibha Masti
projects.interns: Rida Javed Kutty, Roshni P N, Shreya S Adiga

projects.title: VayuBhoomi
projects.short_description: Autonomous UAV-UGV networking framework deployed for waste disposal.
projects.long_description: VayuBhoomi is a framework for networking of aerial and ground based robots. The USP of the project as compared to past research is creating a robust system between an Unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) and an unmanned ground vehicle (UGV). The use case chosen to demonstrate this is trash collection over open spaces. We use the UAV to conduct surveillance over a specified area, the UAV patrols a pre planned path and spirals inwards, in the process deploying trajectory tracking and image processing. It identifies and stores the location of the garbage and sends it to the UGV, which proceeds to travel to the garbage and collect and dispose of it while avoiding any obstacles.
projects.mentors: Harshith Kumar, Shayak Bhadraray, T Vijay Prashant
projects.interns: Pramuk M P, Samuel Thomas, Sriram Radhakrishna

projects.title: PseudoDeploy
projects.short_description: Emulation and monitoring of arbitrary Federated Learning setups using Kubernetes.
projects.long_description:
Pseudodeploy is a tool that aims to make federated learning research easy by allowing researchers to create (otherwise expensive) experimental setups using powerful cloud-native technologies and orchestration, while allowing them to vary real-life parameters such as compute power limits and bandwidth limits.
We use Kubernetes to perform this automation, while supporting python as the implementation language given its frequency in research usage.
projects.keywords: Federated Learning, Kubernetes, Docker, Distributed Systems, Grafana Monitoring
projects.interns: Anirudh Rowjee, Shubhankar V Kuranagatti, Urmil Kalaria

projects.title: Flo(v)ver
projects.short_description: A Static Profiler to track error propagation through C code.
projects.long_description: Flo(v)ver aims to categorically detect precision errors in floating-point programs arising out of the innate error associated with representing a real number in a computing system. Static analysis techniques were used to provide a user-friendly command-line tool capable of checking for common errors associated with floats, including failed assertions, inequality errors, and rounding, chopping, and other machining errors.
projects.keywords: Floating points, Numerical analysis, Compiler design, precision, C
projects.interns: Disha Jain, Gagan Prashanth K, Vishal J Lodha

projects.title: Vyaakaran
projects.short_description: A Turing Machine Simulator for an edu-webtool.
projects.long_description: Vyakaran is an educational web-tool built to help anyone understand and visualize automata theory. It has support for Regular Grammar, Context Free Grammar and powerful testing tools to help the user test automata. We focus on extending this tool to enable simulation of a Turing Machine with it's tape. To be specific, we take state transitions from the user in a given syntax and compile it to generate a graph and a tape to visualize the Turing Machine.
projects.keywords: Turing Machine, Automata, Vue, Compiler Design, Simulaton
projects.interns: Abishek Deivam, Tarun M, Thejas N U

projects.title: ViPyr
projects.short_description: A Python front-end framework inspired by ReactJs.
projects.long_description:
Our project aims to make a frontend framework built with the principles of React 
[a very popular javascript framework] that will allow users to create the frontend 
for applications in a pythonic style.
projects.keywords: Python, PyScript, React, WebAssembly, Frontend, Reconcilation
projects.interns: B R Sinchana, Shreyas Kaundinya, Suraj Rao K P

projects.title: (Re)Placement
projects.short_description: An end-to-end software solution for the placement process in universities.
projects.long_description: (Re)Placement is an end-to-end software between the Training & Placement Officer (TPO) and students of a University, aimed at enhancing the placement process of the University. It is an approach for developing a better, organised and efficient system of placements in a universe.
projects.keywords: Placement Process, Software, Automation, Database, Convenience
projects.interns: Pavan Nettam, Rakshitha R, Tanishq Chugh

projects.title: TPML-WLAN
projects.short_description: Throughput prediction in WLAN dense deployments with overlapping BSSs using ML.
projects.long_description: TPML-WLAN or Throughput prediction in wireless local area networks using Machine Learning, is primarily based on predicting the value of throughput in dense deployments which consist of overlapping BSSs (basic service sets). The objective of this project is to utilize and compare the performance of machine learning techniques like Random forest, Linear regression, K nearest neighbors and so on, and deep learning models like artificial neural networks (ANN) and graph neural networks (GNN), by resourcefully manipulating the features of nodes (access points, for example, routers and stations for example, laptops) in a deployment, and to thus arrive at the optimal arrangement of the nodes, providing minimum interference and maximum throughput.
projects.keywords: Networks, Throughput, Internet, Machine Learning, Graph Neural Networks, Prediction
projects.mentors: Professor M Rajasekar, Venkat Ramnan K
projects.interns: Shreyas S, Spoorthi Kalkunte, Varun Satheesh
